html: 10.1.17  1:20 am   so I'm a singer/guitarist and I'm working on an arrangement of "I love you", my current favorite of your songs.  is there a reason you cursed guitarists by writing in Eb?
10.1.17  12:33 am   do you remember me

10.1.17  12:30 am   Images appear to move very musically in your videos. Can you elaborate on the way you make your video synchronize rhythmically with your sound? I imagine it's very hard to make the visual rhythm of the images FEEL in lockstep with the musical rhythm. I wonder how much the visual rhythm informs our experience of the audio rhythm?
10.1.17  12:24 am   How to tell Zebras apart from other striped animals like okapis, tigers, chipmunks, skunks etc.

10.1.17  12:10 am   Hi Bill! Sorry if you're tired of getting hotewig questions.. but I'd like to know more about your thought process/goals for writing the intro part. After the big bang, there's pretty much a straightforward story line for you to follow (if you can call the history of the world straightforward)... but everything from "hi, you're on a rock..." up until "i think there's a universe now" must've been really tricky to write. The origin of the universe (and history of the universe) seems like a real tough story to set the scene for. Did you find it hard to come up with a good intro for the video? (Btw I think you nailed it).

9.30.17  12:08 pm   I know this is probably a tough question, but do you have any tips on writing melodies? If you give me a melody, I can arrange it (figure out harmonies, bass line, drum beats etc)... but I always hear people say that melodies just 'come to them', like they just appear out of nowhere in their heads like magic... but this has never been the case for me. I usually write a chord pattern that I think sounds interesting, then I try to build a melody from the notes in the chords. Sometimes I can do it, sometimes I can't. But I know I'm doing it backwards. Melody should come first. Melody is the most important part of a song.
9.30.17  11:58 am   Your first song I'm stuck in a Rut states that you are indeed stuck in a rut. Are you still stuck in that rut?

9.30.17  11:56 am   9.29.17  9:32 pm I checked with the committee. They told me that they register songs once they are accepted as music. But they're not the ones to determine rather or not something is accepted as music. They told me to refer to you in order to get my Certificate of Acceptance... which I will then have to bring back to them, in order to officially register something as music.
